comment: I took her for 1101 and 1102, and she has been great. She's an easy grader and will always give extensions. Her lectures are very easy to understand and accessible. You do have to go to class and do the prep work though.
Overall a very cherishing teacher. The only downside is I do believe she does grades a little tougher than most teachers.

Dr. Defago was an amazing professor! She taught the class pretty well and helped me learn some new writing strategies through the year. She does assign a lot of prep work though and it can be a lot, but they usually take you maybe 10 minutes each assignment. Really sweet professor too, would absolutely take her again if I could!

Lots of work is required before every class, other teachers might explain and walk through writing papers a little better. Very relaxed about due dates and gives extensions per request but very strict grader.

So nice! I loved her, never raised a red flag. Very understanding about extensions on papers. Lectures always relate to the essay and they were very helpful to me in my writing process. Homework due before each class but they're very easy 10 min assignments. Only 3 essays and a couple minor assignments. I didn't do my best but I def recommend!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Nice professor. The class is easy if you do the work. The system took me a bit to get used to, but basically there's prep-work (homework you do before class), the classwork you do during class, and you have to do the next class day's prep-work. Very helpful and wants you to do a good job!
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Dr. Defago is one of the best teachers I've had! She's not only super cool but also good at explaining stuff. She's understanding about giving extensions on big assignments if you need them. While there's homework, it's never crazy. It's just quick stuff, like less than 10 minutes. If you're thinking about taking her class, definitely go for it

Attendance isn't mandatory but she does take it. I recommend going if not you are going to be behind. She is so sweet and cares about you and wants you to succeed. She is easy to talk to because her classes aren't big. She does have prep work and in-class work. You don't need a textbook for her class. A lot of stuff graded. Easy A 10/10 rec

While Dr. Defago is nice, she is VERY unorganized and opinionated. It's not unusual to wait months before getting papers back, leaving your overall grade in jeopardy. I have also had my opinions questioned rudely multiple times during class time, which is very uncomfortable and unprofessional. Overall she's nice but I wouldn't recommend her.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Defago was an exceptional professor in my ENGL1101 class. Every major assignment has multiple smaller drafts that build up to it, and prep work can help out your grade a ton. As long as you pay attention in class and do your prep work, you will love this class and succeed. She also specializes the course in humor and comedy if you like that.

Dr. Defago is amazing! She makes a point to actually know her students, which makes all the difference in your first college class. Both 1101 and 1102 are graded on three essays. Prep work is extra credit and due at the beginning of class, graded on completion. Very generous with extensions for major assignments. Couldn't recommend her enough!!

I love her so much. She really connects with her students and knows how to keep them engaged. Her assignments are so easy and some assignments are just breakdowns to help you get through writing a paper. Her work is not very hard either

While the actual class work wasn't difficult - it was so boring that the hardest part about this class is getting yourself to care about it. has prep work due before every class - it is incredibly useless. take this class if you enjoy pointless busy work. and she's lowkey always talking about race and the Jews in such an uncomfortable manner

this professor truly cares about her students! attendance is not required but if you miss class you can't make up the work for that day. very generous with deadline extensions. BE PREPARED TO PUT IN WORK OUTSIDE OF CLASS TIME. she almost always has "prep-work" that will be due at the start of each class period. all classwork is graded by completion
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Caring

comment: I had the best experience with this professor. She honestly cares about her students and is willing to help in any way possible!! If I could take her for all my english classes I would be so happy!! i

She is the BEST professor to have for ENGL1101. She is extremely caring, and everything is straight forward. All the minor assignments were super helpful for the major assignments. She brought us donuts and coffee on the last day. She offers so much extra credit and seriously is the kindest professor to have. Take her!!!!!
Very easy as long as you do your work. Just do all the prep work and it will really help you in the long run.
wish i chose a better teacher fr

Dr. Defago is very acknowledgeable, she is pretty good with answering questions and giving advice on assignments. Her lectures are pretty good too. She knows how to make them interesting. 

However, make sure you come to class, since the class is depended on daily participation, I could have easily got an A if I did all the in-class work.
the lectures made everything seem so easy when in reality the actual work was so hard
She's invested in the well being of her students and will make sure that you learn the material if you want to.

This class is graded primarily on 3 units/parts, the first two being papers and the last being a group project. The group project really hurt my grade, causing the 95 I had all semester to be a 86. The professor is a tough grader on the papers, & despite me following the rubric, still ended up getting a 80 on both papers (odd). Wouldn't recommend.

Professor Defago offers a research-based course for ENGL 1102. Before every class, there is prep work which can be readings, quizzes, journals, etc... There are 3 major assignments that make up your grade. Expect to work with your peers in every class. There is a group project towards the end of the semester. No tests or finals!

Dr. Defago is a great teacher. She is very flexible and offers a lot of extra credit. The in-class assignments were not hard at all. Our grade consisted mainly of 3 essays that were just a bit challenging. Her lecturing also ensures that you will walk out with new learning and skills that will help you in the future. She also gave us donuts.

Dr. Defago has structured her class horribly. We were watching comedy skits that had nothing to do with the paper we were watching. No examples, rubrics, or guidance. Better off having Scrappy teach this course tbh.

My class was pretty small so she knew our names. She's very passionate about writing which is encouraging. She's even brought coffee for the students. Attendance IS mandatory, but doesn't seem to mind if you're late. Keep in mind that for pretty much every class you'll be paired up/put into groups of your choice. Buying a textbook wasn't needed imo

Dr. Defago is super sweet! She will definitely work with you on your essays to be successful. There is a lot of prep work so if you aren't someone who likes a lot of that beware. Three essays and attendance isn't required.

Would definitely take again. Do your online assignments and check for prep work every class day. They are easy and quick and you can work ahead. Will walk you through anything if you just ask. Class goes by fast. 3 essays but you feel ready after all of the leading up assignments.

Dr.Defago is so sweet. There's only 3 papers, but if you come to class and do the prep work she makes it so that it adds points to your essay. Attendance isn't required but being in class helps you understand what she wants you to have in your papers. She gives really detailed feedback if you ask for it as well. Im taking her class next semester!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: Loved her. Very to the point and understanding of her students. Really liked the online format and accessibility of the class.

ABSOULTE TAKE! She is kind, forgiving, attentive and considerate. She structured her class on a schedule with assignments (like short answer) that slowly build up components of the 3 or 4 major essays. Attend class, keep up with work, and reach out to her when troubled will ensure an A+. Very easy class, although morning times. We loved her.

I didn't like this class because I thought it was structured poorly. She gave us one rubric for one of our 3 papers. Not very helpful. She was great at first, and she guided us through how to be better students. Then all of a sudden she stopped teaching and we just watched videos that loosely related to the course.

Among the few who have empathy in this dunkpit of a college. I guess she really wants me to pass. Shes really cool. Its just a shame we can speak this language and all she teaches will probably be forgotten. Wished her class wasnt so early at 8 in the morning no less. Cool voice. I would attend her classes but i need my sleep:)
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: She is one of the kindest teachers you could ever get. She makes sure to help you if you reach out and she structures her class really well. Everything you need to know is already posted weeks in advance. The class is overall really easy with only three main essays and the same research topic for each. I would recommend this class.

I couldn't have picked a better English teacher. She helped us sculpt our skills for the future which not many teachers do. She does lots of group discussions which make class fun. Three essays are due but the prompts are fairly easy. She will communicate with you if you need help.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read
